responses.content: Blackwell demand is off the charts, GB300 crossed over GB200, and we now have visibility to $0.5T in Blackwell/Rubin revenue as AI infrastructure spend hits the hundreds of billions.
Rubin CPX, Vera GPU, NVQLink, and NVLink 144 all remain on an annual cadence; our partners have mastered the rack installation process so we can scale Rubin fast.
Networking revenue grew 162% YoY to $8.2B thanks to NVLink, Spectrum-X, Spectrum-XGS, InfiniBand XDR, Quantum-X, and BlueField – every gigawatt AI factory needs these fabrics.

NVIDIA accelerates every phase: CUDA across general-purpose, generative, agentic, and physical AI; no other stack can claim the same breadth across clouds, on-prem, PCs, robots, and quantum interconnects.
Revenue hit $57B, Data Center $51.2B, we released $180M of H20 reserves, returned $10B to shareholders, and added $60B to repurchase capacity while keeping CapEx focused on Blackwell/GB300 supply.
Q4 guidance $65B, margins ~74.8/75%, operating expenses ~6.7/5.0B, tax ~17%; we assume no China shipments and still expect mid-70s margin exit despite high-30s% OpEx growth.
Inventory and supply commitments expanded to prepare for Rubin rollouts, while US wafer capacity and partner factories (TSMC Arizona, Foxconn, Wistron) ensure reliability.

questions: Are you still tracking toward the $500B Blackwell plus Rubin revenue target and is there upside given the new sovereign and KSA programs?
With wafer-to-rack lead times of 12 months, how do you see the split between networking and compute growth over the next year?
What $/GW assumptions underpin the $500B number and how much of the future AI infrastructure needs vendor financing versus customer cash?
How will you deploy the anticipated free cash flow – buybacks versus ecosystem investments like OpenAI/Anthropic – and what criteria guide those decisions?
Has your view on ASIC threats changed and what makes NVIDIA's GPU+networking+software stack still the preferred defense against nimble ASIC opponents?
How should we apportion the $7B sequential growth across Blackwell, Hopper/H20, and networking given the continued Blackwell dominance?
Is the Q4 outlook still built assuming zero China shipments, and what evidence would change that stance?

metadata.source: NVIDIA FY 2026 Q3 earnings call transcript
